verses.roman:
tabe miśra purātana eka dhuti dila
teṅho dui bahirvāsa-kaupīna karila

synonyms: tabe—thereafter; miśra—Tapana Miśra; purātana—old; eka—one; dhuti—dhoti; dila—delivered; teṅho—he (Sanātana Gosvāmī); dui—two; bahirvāsa—outer coverings; kaupīna—underwear; karila—made.
translation: When Tapana Miśra gave Sanātana Gosvāmī a used dhoti, Sanātana immediately tore it in pieces to make two sets of outer cloth and underwear.
